section.p: Create a relationship between the tables BoxDetails and Pralines and enforce referential integrity.

section.title: Solution
section.p: The tables BoxDetails and Pralines have field PralineCode as a common field. PralineCode is the key in table Pralines; so Pralines is the primary table (the one-side). A PralineCode can occur more than once in table BoxDetails, so BoxDetails is the many-side. Choose tab Database Tools Relationships (group Relationships) . Select field PralineCode in table Pralines and drag it to field PralineCode in table BoxDetails. Check the box Enforce Referential Integrity.
